abstract: The Texas Rangers and the importance of suffering to fandom.
snippet: The Texas Rangers and the importance of suffering to fandom.
lead_paragraph: Last Thursday, just before the sixth game of the World Series, ESPN's Jayson Stark wrote a piece about the Texas Rangers' relationship to their local sports fans, suggesting that the team's recent success and potential title might be finally earning them a place in the hearts of Dallas's football-mad faithful. Despite their long World Series drought, Stark noted, the Rangers had never inspired the same kind of undying passion as frustrated franchises like the Cubs or Indians or pre-2004 Red Sox: Instead of agonizing over their baseball nine's inability to win it all, the Dallas-Fort Worth fan base mainly just ignored them. But a Rangers victory over the Saint Louis Cardinals, he suggested, might change all that: "If these Rangers find a way to win just one more time, life in Texas may never be the same all-Cowboys-all-the-time universe again."

headline.main: It Is Designed to Break Your Heart
